019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.JsonArray;
022import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
023import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
025import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
026import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
027import java.io.IOException;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Collections;
030import java.util.List;
031import java.util.Map;
032import java.util.Optional;
033import java.util.Set;
034import java.util.logging.Level;
035import java.util.stream.Collectors;
036import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
037import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
038import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
039import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
040import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sObserver.ResponseType;
041import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1ConfigMapStub;
042import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1PodStub;
043import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1StatefulSetStub;
044import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinition;
045import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionModel;
046import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionModels;
047import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionStub;
048import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.APP_NAME;
049import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
050import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_NAME;
051import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ChannelManager;
052import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
053import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
054import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.DataPath;
055import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
056import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
057import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
058
059/**
060 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
061 */
062@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
063public class VmMonitor extends
064        AbstractMonitor<VmDefinitionModel, VmDefinitionModels, VmChannel> {
065
066    private final ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> channelManager;
067
068    /**
069     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
070     *
071     * @param componentChannel the component channel
072     * @param channelManager the channel manager
073     */
074    public VmMonitor(Channel componentChannel,
075            ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> channelManager) {
076        super(componentChannel, VmDefinitionModel.class,
077            VmDefinitionModels.class);
078        this.channelManager = channelManager;
079    }
080
081    @Override
082    protected void prepareMonitoring() throws IOException, ApiException {
083        client(new K8sClient());
084
085        // Get all our API versions
086        var ctx = K8s.context(client(), VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM);
087        if (ctx.isEmpty()) {
088            logger.severe(() -> "Cannot get CRD context.");
089            return;
090        }
091        context(ctx.get());
092
093        // Remove left over resources
094        purge();
095    }
096
097    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CognitiveComplexity")
098    private void purge() throws ApiException {
099        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
100        var known = K8sDynamicStub.list(client(), context(), namespace())
101            .stream().map(stub -> stub.name()).collect(Collectors.toSet());
102        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
103        opts.setLabelSelector(
104            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=" + VM_OP_NAME + ","
105                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME);
106        for (var context : Set.of(K8sV1StatefulSetStub.CONTEXT,
107            K8sV1ConfigMapStub.CONTEXT)) {
108            for (var resStub : K8sDynamicStub.list(client(), context,
109                namespace(), opts)) {
110                String instance = resStub.model()
111                    .map(m -> m.metadata().getName()).orElse("(unknown)");
112                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
113                    resStub.delete();
114                }
115            }
116        }
117    }
118
119    @Override
120    protected void handleChange(K8sClient client,
121            Watch.Response<VmDefinitionModel> response) {
122        V1ObjectMeta metadata = response.object.getMetadata();
123        VmChannel channel = channelManager.channelGet(metadata.getName());
124
125        // Remove from channel manager if deleted
126        if (ResponseType.valueOf(response.type) == ResponseType.DELETED) {
127            channelManager.remove(metadata.getName());
128        }
129
130        // Get full definition and associate with channel as backup
131        var vmModel = response.object;
132        if (vmModel.data() == null) {
133            // ADDED event does not provide data, see
134            // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/3215
135            vmModel = getModel(client, vmModel);
136        }
137        VmDefinition vmDef = null;
138        if (vmModel.data() != null) {
139            // New data, augment and save
140            addDynamicData(channel.client(), vmModel, channel.vmModel());
141            channel.setVmModel(vmModel);
142            vmDef = client.getJSON().getGson().fromJson(vmModel.data(),
143                VmDefinition.class);
144            addDynamicData(channel.client(), vmDef, channel.vmDefinition());
145            channel.setVmDefinition(vmDef);
146        }
147        if (vmDef == null) {
148            // Reuse cached (e.g. if deleted)
149            vmModel = channel.vmModel();
150            vmDef = channel.vmDefinition();
151        }
152        if (vmDef == null) {
153            logger.warning(() -> "Cannot get defintion for "
154                + response.object.getMetadata());
155            return;
156        }
157
158        // Create and fire changed event. Remove channel from channel
159        // manager on completion.
160        channel.pipeline()
161            .fire(Event.onCompletion(
162                new VmDefChanged(ResponseType.valueOf(response.type),
163                    channel.setGeneration(
164                        response.object.getMetadata().getGeneration()),
165                    vmModel, vmDef),
166                e -> {
167                    if (e.type() == ResponseType.DELETED) {
168                        channelManager
169                            .remove(e.vmModel().metadata().getName());
170                    }
171                }), channel);
172    }
173
174    private VmDefinitionModel getModel(K8sClient client,
175            VmDefinitionModel vmDef) {
176        try {
177            return VmDefinitionStub.get(client, context(), namespace(),
178                vmDef.metadata().getName()).model().orElse(null);
179        } catch (ApiException e) {
180            return null;
181        }
182    }
183
184    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
185    private void addDynamicData(K8sClient client, VmDefinition vmDef,
186            VmDefinition prevState) {
187        // Maintain (or initialize) the resetCount
188        vmDef.extra("resetCount",
189            Optional.ofNullable(prevState).map(d -> d.extra("resetCount"))
190                .orElse(0L));
191
192        // Node information
193        // Add defaults in case the VM is not running
194        vmDef.extra("nodeName", "");
195        vmDef.extra("nodeAddress", "");
196
197        // VM definition status changes before the pod terminates.
198        // This results in pod information being shown for a stopped
199        // VM which is irritating. So check condition first.
200        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LambdaCanBeMethodReference")
201        var isRunning = DataPath
202            .<List<Map<String, Object>>> get(vmDef.status(), "conditions")
203            .orElse(Collections.emptyList()).stream()
204            .filter(cond -> DataPath.get(cond, "type")
205                .map(t -> "Running".equals(t)).orElse(false))
206            .findFirst().map(cond -> DataPath.get(cond, "status")
207                .map(s -> "True".equals(s)).orElse(false))
208            .orElse(false);
209        if (!isRunning) {
210            return;
211        }
212        var podSearch = new ListOptions();
213        podSearch.setLabelSelector("app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME
214            + ",app.kubernetes.io/component=" + APP_NAME
215            + ",app.kubernetes.io/instance=" + vmDef.name());
216        try {
217            var podList
218                = K8sV1PodStub.list(client, namespace(), podSearch);
219            for (var podStub : podList) {
220                var nodeName = podStub.model().get().getSpec().getNodeName();
221                vmDef.extra("nodeName", nodeName);
222                logger.fine(() -> "Added node name " + nodeName
223                    + " to VM info for " + vmDef.name());
224                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
225                var addrs = new ArrayList<String>();
226                podStub.model().get().getStatus().getPodIPs().stream()
227                    .map(ip -> ip.getIp()).forEach(addrs::add);
228                vmDef.extra("nodeAddresses", addrs);
229                logger.fine(() -> "Added node addresses " + addrs
230                    + " to VM info for " + vmDef.name());
231            }
232        } catch (ApiException e) {
233            logger.log(Level.WARNING, e,
234                () -> "Cannot access node information: " + e.getMessage());
235        }
236    }
237
238    @Deprecated
239    private void addDynamicData(K8sClient client, VmDefinitionModel vmState,
240            VmDefinitionModel prevState) {
241        var rootNode = GsonPtr.to(vmState.data()).get(JsonObject.class);
242
243        // Add defaults in case the VM is not running
244        rootNode.addProperty("nodeName", "");
245        rootNode.addProperty("nodeAddress", "");
246
247        // VM definition status changes before the pod terminates.
248        // This results in pod information being shown for a stopped
249        // VM which is irritating. So check condition first.
250        var isRunning = GsonPtr.to(rootNode).to("status", "conditions")
251            .get(JsonArray.class)
252            .asList().stream().filter(el -> "Running"
253                .equals(((JsonObject) el).get("type").getAsString()))
254            .findFirst().map(el -> "True"
255                .equals(((JsonObject) el).get("status").getAsString()))
256            .orElse(false);
257        if (!isRunning) {
258            return;
259        }
260        var podSearch = new ListOptions();
261        podSearch.setLabelSelector("app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME
262            + ",app.kubernetes.io/component=" + APP_NAME
263            + ",app.kubernetes.io/instance=" + vmState.getMetadata().getName());
264        try {
265            var podList
266                = K8sV1PodStub.list(client, namespace(), podSearch);
267            for (var podStub : podList) {
268                var nodeName = podStub.model().get().getSpec().getNodeName();
269                rootNode.addProperty("nodeName", nodeName);
270                logger.fine(() -> "Added node name " + nodeName
271                    + " to VM info for " + vmState.getMetadata().getName());
272                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
273                var addrs = new JsonArray();
274                podStub.model().get().getStatus().getPodIPs().stream()
275                    .map(ip -> ip.getIp()).forEach(addrs::add);
276                rootNode.add("nodeAddresses", addrs);
277                logger.fine(() -> "Added node addresses " + addrs
278                    + " to VM info for " + vmState.getMetadata().getName());
279            }
280        } catch (ApiException e) {
281            logger.log(Level.WARNING, e,
282                () -> "Cannot access node information: " + e.getMessage());
283        }
284    }
285}
